newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK 97 POTATO CROP ESTIMATED AT 647,100 TONNES.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK 97 POTATO CROP ESTIMATED AT 647,100 TONNES.

text.p: Slovakia's 1997 potato crop is estimated to yield around 647,100 tonnes from an area of 39,600 hectares, a per-hectare yield of 16.34 tonnes, the official TASR news agency reported on Thursday.

Quoting a report by the ministry of agriculture TASR said the sown areas for potatoes in Slovakia had gradually decreased to 39,900 in 1995 from 58,200 hectares in 1986 as a result of changes to fodder technology and less use of potatoes in industrial processing for starch and alcohol.

In 1996 the overall sown area increased to 40,800 hectares, 2.5 percent more than in 1995. Overall potato production in 1996 totalled 776,600 tonnes, an increase of 75.9 percent over 1995 as a result of favourable weather conditions which enabled a per-hectare yield of 19.02 tonnes, TASR said.
The ministry issued the following Slovak potato crop survey (early consumer potatoes, other consumer and seed potatoes):
Harvest area Index Yield Production Index
